snippet: Some psychiatrists are teaching pediatricians how to evaulate children’s mental health issues like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which some doctors diagnose despite having little training.
abstract: Some psychiatrists are teaching pediatricians how to evaluate children’s mental health issues like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which some doctors diagnose despite having little training; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says one in seven children in the United States, and almost 20 percent of all boys, receives diagnosis of ADHD by time they turn 18.
lead_paragraph: Some psychiatrists are teaching pediatricians how to evaulate children’s mental health issues like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which some doctors diagnose despite having little training.

headline.main: Doctors Train to Spot Signs of A.D.H.D. in Children
headline.print_headline: Doctors Train to Spot Signs of A.D.H.D. in Children

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
